issue.title: [C++] Create and install static library containing all dependencies built by Arrow
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-7605](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7605). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
If ARROW_JEMALLOC=ON, then currently the libarrow.a cannot be used for static linking without also obtaining libjemalloc_pic.a

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7605?focusedCommentId=17069039) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I haven't forgotten about this. This change is too risky to rush into 0.17.0 but I hope to have a patch ready for it in the near future that we can make sure it robust to different scenarios after 0.17.0 goes out. If someone wants to pick up the project from me, you are welcome to do so

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7605?focusedCommentId=17094355) by Paul Balanca (balancap):*
Is there a working way of static compiling with Arrow 0.17.0? I am getting these linking errors due to jemalloc.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7605?focusedCommentId=17094537) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I need someone to pick up the PR and help, I have too little time to work on this. I'm writing an e-mail to the mailing list about it now

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7605?focusedCommentId=17155763) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
